--- In neat@yahoogroups.com, Colin Green <cgreen@d...> wrote:
> 
> Now this depends on the fitness space, but it seems to me that 
it's 
> likely these new species will get stuck in the same local peaks, 
> especially if they are very deep and/or broad, since they are 
spawned 
> off of species that are already stuck. Thus I was thinking that a 
pool 
> of dead species (or a token genome from each, say the species 
champ) 
> could be kept and that we could implement some mechanism for 
avoiding 
> the area of the fitness space represented by these genomes - using 
the 
> genome compatibility function.
> 
> I need to think through the specifics on this but it seems to make 
sense 
> because it forces the search into new areas (or it could if 
implemented 
> properly). The problem is how do we ensure we generate new genomes 
that 
> are sufficiently different enough from the dead species to go and 
> explore new areas of the search space? The answer may lie within 
the 
> above discussion(s).
> 
> 

Colin, this sounds like a really interesting idea.  I need to think 
about it also.  I like the idea of keeping away from places that 
already got stuck.  

ken
